content: Hey folks! We have an exciting new feature being tested on chat.zulip.org starting now: We now use a pills-based styling when composing a PM to another user. It's #7155 (not merged yet!) but I've test-deployed it here so that we can get feedback and folks can try to find bugs, before we merge it to master.
The main thing I've noticed that's broken so far is copy/paste isn't implemented yet.
cool! A small thing is that the "You and" black part of the compose box now looks really big.

Yeah, the font sizes don't match I think? I also wonder whether we want to do something where the pills sorta inherit the black background from the "You and" to look more similar to what the PM thread headings look like?
yeah, that might be a good idea. The pills also feel less visible to me than the text it replaces, maybe because of being overpowered by the "You and"?
I've never liked the "You and" part. Speaking of the text, not the looks.
Yeah, I was just chatting with Brock about tossing that for the next revision :)

a ) x could use some bottom margin.
pasted image

b) Slack also shows the profile picture (not sure whether we should include it but it looks good)
pasted image
c) IMO, I would not want Add another user.. text when I click on a user from the right sidebar to do a PM.
pasted image

a ) x could use some bottom margin.
pasted image

Please ignore this (I'm using the app with font-size 15px which caused the extra top margin)

I think the profile picture could be a nice addition.
Another thing I noticed is we possibly shouldn't have the "add another user" placeholder text when the PM narrow matches what's in the pills.
Yeah, I like the profile picture idea. Shouldn't be too hard to implement, since we have all the data in place.

I like the new "To:", by the way.

A minor comment is that the placeholder text is not vertically aligned with the "To:", though I'm sure that can be fixed if we go with this solution.
pasted image
@Brock Whittaker can you do a quick fix to that alignment issue?
Why is it so that the android app has the hamburger menu but the ios app doesn't? Is it due to any specific design disparities in the platform's design architecture?
@Anurag Goel are you talking about the actual app you download from the app store or the website you see on a phone? If the first the #mobile stream is the right place to discuss.
If the app, are you using the new or the old app?
@Boris Yankov Ok I will keep that in mind. Im running the latest development build on the iphone simulator.
I suspect you are comparing it to an older version of the Android app. The latest version is almost identical to our code in master
@Boris Yankov Im using v9.2.68 which is the latest on the play store. This version has the hamburger menu. I guess that the newest version on master is not available on play store.
Ah, we did have it only in Beta but I intended to push to production too. I did publish and it will soon update for you.

On the current Android beta, I don't have a hamburger menu; instead, when I'm looking at messages the top left of the screen has a left-arrow icon, which takes me up from a topic to the stream and then to the navigation drawer.
Ah, raced with Boris :)

The publishing process for both Android and iOS is super asynchronous and it often happens for something to not get done. I need to do the submission + Beta releases + Public + rejection resolution at different intervals.
Please take this to #mobile.

@Akash Nimare how is your screenshot here:

https://chat.zulip.org/user_uploads/2/2c/M84h1FapW4A8dKu2zY124_cw/pasted_image.png

So messed up? Browser? OS? I can't replicate that look at all.
Is this just from a font size issue?
@Brock Whittaker I think he was playing with modifying the font size manually, yeah. You can ignore.

Back to the original issue, I think we've resolved the various bug reports about this new PM recipient compose area. We can probably iterate more on the design over time, but how do folks feel about to what extent it's better or worse than the previous design? (I.e., should we merge it and build from there).

Definitely better!

The one thing I can think of that is a regression in one area is that if you reply to a PM thread, we show the text "Add another user...", and that feels kind of distracting as that's 95% of the time not what you want.
Hmm, yeah, we should hide that if you're in an appropriate narrow or something.
(And basically asks the user to understand more of the Zulip model of conversations and specifically of group PMs than they need to to reply to that thread.)
I think that element does make sense if you're composing something to a place you're not looking at.
Yeah -- I think where I really want it hidden is when replying.

Like it should still work if you shift-tab to that element (in order to compose to some other group), but that's an awfully power-user feature and I think not a common thing even for power users to do -- so it doesn't need to give the prompt unless you do move the focus there.
yeah, agreed (we should remove the placeholder if the set of pills matches the narrow, and your cursor is not focused on the line with the pills.)

Just following up here, the PM pills system is now merged, which is exciting. I think we haven't taken action related to the placeholder discussion here; @Rishi Gupta; so I think we should open an issue for fixing that up (I'd tag it as "blocker" so we deal before the release).

If there are other issues folks have noticed with the new PM pills, I'd love to hear reports about them, since this is one of the larger changes going into this release.
Opened as #8622
Fix merged and deployed (with a slightly different solution).
